item.title: By: Arie Folger
item.dc:creator: Arie Folger
item.description:
"(3) We need a greater recognition of the role of patient autonomy is needed, similar to Western medical ethics. This goes with a lesser rabbinic presence."
Why? That's like shooting the arrow and then drawing the bull's eye around it. He is clearly less interested in ethics and more in rationalizing an a priori utilitarian desire. Let him argue why patient autonomy should be an important priority in Jewish medical ethics and see whether that is generates a halakhic consensus.
item.content:encoded:
“(3) We need a greater recognition of the role of patient autonomy is needed, similar to Western medical ethics. This goes with a lesser rabbinic presence.”

Why? That’s like shooting the arrow and then drawing the bull’s eye around it. He is clearly less interested in ethics and more in rationalizing an a priori utilitarian desire. Let him argue why patient autonomy should be an important priority in Jewish medical ethics and see whether that is generates a halakhic consensus.
